summary: This document is a declaration by Thelma Guzman, a custodian of records for T-Mobile US, Inc., certifying the authenticity of phone records produced in response to a lawful request. It covers call details and subscriber information for a specific phone number from July 5, 2019, to October 23, 2019, and is intended to satisfy federal evidence rules.

persons.name: Thelma Guzman
persons.role: Custodian of Records for T-Mobile US, Inc.
persons.context: She attests under penalty of perjury to the authenticity of phone records produced by T-Mobile in response to a lawful request, as part of her duties.

events.title: Declaration of Records Authenticity
events.description: Thelma Guzman signs a declaration certifying the authenticity of T-Mobile phone records produced in Case No. 2520720.

events.title: Phone Records Period
events.description: The certified phone records cover call details and subscriber information for this date range.

keyFacts: T-Mobile US, Inc. produced phone records (call details and subscriber info) for a specific number from July 5, 2019, to October 23, 2019, in response to a lawful request under Case No. 2520720.
Thelma Guzman, as Custodian of Records, certified the records' authenticity under penalty of perjury, complying with Federal Rules of Evidence 803(6), 902(11), 902(13), and/or 902(14).
The document is a formal legal declaration intended to establish the business records exception for the phone records in a legal proceeding.
The records were produced by T-Mobile's Law Enforcement Relations Group, indicating the request was likely from a law enforcement or government agency.
